opendial

Class DialogueState

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.BNetwork
      • opendial.DialogueState

  • public class DialogueState
extends BNetwork
    Representation of a dialogue state. A dialogue state is essentially a directed graphical model (i.e. a Bayesian or decision network) over a set of specific state variables. Probabilistic rules can be applied on this dialogue state in order to update its content. After applying the rules, the dialogue state is usually pruned to only retain relevant state variables. The dialogue state may also include an assignment of evidence values. A subset of state variables can be marked as denoting parameter variables.

    • Constructor Summary

      • addToState_incremental

        public void addToState_incremental(CategoricalTable distrib,
                                   boolean followPrevious)
        Concatenates the current value for the new content onto the current content, if followPrevious is true. Else, simply overwrites the current content of the variable.
        Parameters:
        distrib - the distribution to add as incremental unit of content
        followPrevious - whether the results should be concatenated to the previous values, or reset the content (e.g. when starting a new utterance)

      • addToState

        public void addToState(DialogueState newState)
        Merges the dialogue state included as argument into the current one.
        Parameters:
        newState - the state to merge into the current state dialogue state could not be merged

      • removeFromState

        public void removeFromState(java.lang.String variableId)
        Removes the variable from the dialogue state
        Parameters:
        variableId - the node to remove

      • applyRule

        public void applyRule(Rule r)
        Applies a (probability or utility) rule to the dialogue state:
        • For a probability rule, the method creates a chance node containing the rule effects depending on the input variables of the rule, and connected via outgoing edges to the output variables.
        • For a utility rule, the method creates a utility node specifying the utility of particular actions specified by the rule depending on the input variables.

        The method creates both the rule node, its corresponding output or action nodes, and the directed edges resulting from the rule application. See Pierre Lison's PhD thesis, Section 4.3 for details.

        Parameters:
        r - the rule to apply.

      • setAsNew

        public void setAsNew()
        Sets the dialogue state to consist of all new variables (to trigger right after the system initialisation.
